arm_group.description: Subjects with multiple nose telangiectasias will be enrolled. One nose telangiectasia (of 5) will be treated with pulsed dye laser.
Subjects with multiple nose telangiectasias will be enrolled. One nose telangiectasia (of 5) will be treated with long pulsed alexandrite laser.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Pulsed Dye Laser Plus Nd:YAG Laser
arm_group.description: Subjects with multiple nose telangiectasias will be enrolled. One nose telangiectasia (of 5) will be treated with pulsed dye laser plus Nd:YAG laser.
Subjects with multiple nose telangiectasias will be enrolled. One nose telangiectasia (of 5) will be treated with electrodesiccation.
Subjects with multiple nose telangiectasias will be enrolled. One nose telangiectasia (of 5) will receive no treatment.

brief_summary.textblock:
The aim of this study is to compare the efficacy of various treatment options for
      eliminating nasal telangiectasias. The study will compare the outcome of treating nasal
      telangiectasias with the following; no treatment (control site), alexandrite laser, pulsed
      dye laser, combination pulsed dye laser and Nd:YAG 1064nm multiplex laser system and
      electrosurgery.

clinical_study.brief_title: Laser Therapy Versus Electrosurgery For Nasal Telangiectasias

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Over 18 years of age

          -  Able to give informed consent themselves

          -  Willing to return for follow up visit

          -  0.5 - 3 millimeter Vessel size

          -  5 Non-contiguous nasal vascular lesions

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Mentally handicapped

          -  Unable to understand written and oral English

          -  Incarceration

          -  Under 18 years of age

          -  Unwilling to return for follow up

          -  Pregnant Women

          -  Vessels less than 0.5 millimeter caliber

          -  Less than 5 non-contiguous vessels

intervention.description: Pulsed dye laser treatments will be performed with a 595 nanometer wavelength, 20 millisecond pulse duration, at 10 Joules/cm2, with a 10 millimeter spot size.
intervention.other_name: Pulsed dye laser treatments will be performed with a 595 nanometer wavelength, 20 millisecond pulse duration, at 10 Joules/cm2, with a 10 millimeter spot size.

intervention.description: Alexandrite laser will be used with a 755 nanometer wavelength, 40 millisecond pulse duration, at 88Joules/cm2, with a 6 millimeter spot size.

intervention.arm_group_label: Pulsed Dye Laser Plus Nd:YAG Laser
intervention.description: The Cynergy with MultiPlex will be used with a multiplex mode system with a pulse dye laser at 585 nanometer wavelength, 20 milliseconds pulse duration, at 7 Joules/cm2 with a 7 millimeter spot size, with a short delay, followed by a Nd:YAG 1064 nanometer wavelength, 20 millisecond pulse duration, at 50 Joules/cm2 with a 7 millimeter spot size.
intervention.intervention_name: Pulsed Dye Laser Plus Nd:YAG Laser

intervention.description: A curette is used to scrape off the cancer down to the dermis. The scraping is then paused while an electrosurgical device like a hyfrecator is used next. Electrodesiccation is performed over the raw surgical ulcer to denature a layer of the dermis and the curette is used again over the surgical ulcer to remove denatured dermis down to living tissue.

link.description: University of California-Davis Department of Dermatology Clinical Research

facility.name: University of California-Davis, Department of Dermatology

clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Laser Therapy Vs Electrosurgery For Nasal Telangiectasias Using A Novel Vascular Imaging Device

primary_outcome.description: The study will measure the changes in length and width (area) of nasal telangiectasias  before and after treatment with the following: no treatment (control site), alexandrite laser, pulsed dye laser, combination pulsed dye laser and Nd:YAG 1064nm multiplex laser system and electrosurgery.
primary_outcome.measure: Reduction of Area of Nasal Telangiectasias by Laser Therapy Vs Electrosurgery

secondary_outcome.description: Percent perceived improvement for nasal vessels by the patient via questionnaire.
